memberdef.type: std::conditional_t< has_single_batch_at_compile_time, View, View< T, I, S, D, I, O > >
memberdef.definition: using batmat::matrix::View< T, I, S, D, L, O >::general_slice_view_type = std::conditional_t<has_single_batch_at_compile_time, View, View<T, I, S, D, I, O>>
memberdef.name: general_slice_view_type

briefdescription.para: When slicing along the outer dimension, the layer stride stays the same, but the outer size may be smaller, which means that even if the original view has a default layer stride, the sliced view may require a dynamic layer stride.

detaileddescription.para: For a single batch, the layer stride is not relevant, so it is preserved.

memberdef.definition: using batmat::matrix::View< T, I, S, D, L, O >::col_slice_view_type = std::conditional_t<is_row_major, View, general_slice_view_type>
memberdef.name: col_slice_view_type

briefdescription.para: View with the correct layer stride when slicing along the column dimension.

detaileddescription.para: For row-major storage, slicing along columns does not change the outer size, in which case the layer stride is still correct. For column-major storage, slicing along columns does change the outer size, in which case we need a dynamic layer stride.

memberdef.definition: using batmat::matrix::View< T, I, S, D, L, O >::row_slice_view_type = std::conditional_t<is_column_major, View, general_slice_view_type>
memberdef.name: row_slice_view_type

briefdescription.para: View with the correct layer stride when slicing along the row dimension.

memberdef.name: get_layer_stride_for

briefdescription.para: Non-owning view of a batch of matrices.

parameterdescription.para: Index and size type. Usually std::ptrdiff_t or int.
Inner stride type (batch size). Usually std::integral_constant<I, N> for some N.
Batch depth type. Usually equal to S for a single batch, or I for a dynamic depth.

Layer stride type. Usually DefaultStride (which implies that the layer stride is equal to outer_stride() * outer_size()), or I for a dynamic layer stride. Dynamic strides are used for subviews of views with a larger outer_size().

node.label: batmat::matrix::Layout< index_t, std::integral_constant< index_t, 1 >, index_t, DefaultStride, StorageOrder::ColMajor >
batmat::matrix::View< T, I, S, D, L, O >
